title: SHM - rocks on space station and planet

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.A scientist is on a space station orbiting another planet in an apparently weightless environment. The scientist is tasked with developing a method to measure the unknown mass of a rock sample that came from the planet’s surface. The scientist has a collection of springs of different, known spring constants. The rock can be attached to each of the springs using a fastener of negligible mass.(a) Describe an experimental procedure that (<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>) uses the springs with known spring constants and (<math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>) would allow the scientist to determine the rock’s mass by making a linear graph. Include steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.
